metadata.dc:description: We have evaluated the efficacy of fluconazole, 50 mg/day for 2 weeks, to treat oropharyngeal candidiasis in immunologically compromised patients. There were overall 27 patients, 25 of which were HIV+ and 2 had neutropenia. The rate of clinical response at the end of therapy, and one week and one month afterwards were 96%, 76% and 64%, respectively. The microbiological eradication was achieved in 36% of patients. The tolerance of the drug was satisfactory, although in 3 cases features of hepatic toxicity were detected. The convenience, good tolerance and clinical efficacy of fluconazole make it the therapy of choice for oropharyngeal candidiasis in immunologically compromised patients.
metadata.dc:title: Estudio multicéntrico de fluconazol en el tratamiento de la candidiasis orofaríngea en pacientes inmunodeprimidos.
[Multicenter study of fluconazole in the treatment of oropharyngeal candidiasis in immunodepressed patients].
